chapter.title: Associate Counterparty with Customer
chapter.para: The Data Maintenance > Counterparties function on the Trade Administration menu (click Middle-Office on your main menu to open this) maintains a list of companies that your bank deals with - for example, when creating an Export LC notification, a user at your bank fills in the beneficiary field by selecting a company from this list. These companies are called counterparties.

Similarly, users at a client company can create and maintain a list of counterparties that their company deals with. A client administrator who has the enabled can, in defining a new counterparty, create a login ID for that counterparty. This enables users at the counterparty to connect to to see tasks assigned to them.

If you, as a bank administrator, have the enabled, you can associate counterparties created by one client with other clients as well. This enables these other clients to deal with the counterparty too. Moreover, any initiation of a trade product is immediately notified to the counterparty. For example, when an initiation of Import Letter of Credit is validated by the Issuing Bank, it is immediately advised to the beneficiary as an Export Letter of Credit.
You do this using Customer Maintenance > Associate Counterparty(ies) With Customer on the System Features menu.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of clients and their counterparties.

You can select which entries are shown, by entering search criteria in the Entity, Customer Abbreviated Name, Customer Name, Counterparty Abbreviated Name, and/or Counterparty Name fields. You can use wildcards in these fields.

Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. You can click the checkbox in the header of the list select or unselect all the checkboxes in the list. A button at the end of the page displays a page where you can associate the selected counterparties with an additional client.
When you click this button, you are presented with a list of clients.
You can select which entries are shown, by entering search criteria in the Customer Abbreviated Name and/or Customer Name fields. You can use wildcards in these fields.
The list has the following columns:

entry.para: The customer abbreviated name. It is a hyperlink to associate the counterparty with the existing customer.
